Odyssey Club Privacy Policy - Safeguarding Your Data Skip to content Our Teaching Team Admissions FAQs Apply now Apply now Our Teaching Team Admissions FAQs Enroll Now It is our mission to help middle school students explore the professional world. To achieve this, we have designed a year-long, structured fellowship where students will get hands-on exposure to the world of work and personalised coaching. It is hence critical that we create a safe and secure environment where teachers, children, and parents freely share content and ideas. Creating such a safe and secure environment is central to the success of our endeavours. Last Updated: October 8, 2023 Introduction This Privacy Policy governs the use of data collected by our website www.odyssey.school and our Odyssey Fellowship Program (hereafter, collectively referred to as “the Service”, “Odyssey”, or “the Odyssey Fellowship”). By using Odyssey, you are agreeing to this Privacy Policy. If you do not agree, please refrain from using Odyssey. You can contact us anytime with queries about this Privacy Policy at privacy@odyssey.club . Definitions Profile: This includes personally identifiable information that we collect when you register for the Service. This may include First Name, Last Name, Email, and Phone Number of the user. Student Data: Any data collected by Odyssey that can be linked back to an individual student. This contains name, age, Email ID, name of parents, school name, phone number and the assessment data. Odyssey Program Data: Information related to the students’ participation, progress, and performance within the Odyssey Fellowship Program. “Program Insights” Odyssey analyses the Odyssey Program Data and converts them into actionable points to support teachers in teaching and learning. This set of actionable data-points is collectively referred to as Insights. What is Odyssey? Odyssey is a year-long fellowship program for middle school students, designed to explore the world of work, discover passions, and acquire vital interdisciplinary skills. It combines live online and in-person sessions, providing exposure to various career domains and personalized coaching. Odyssey is committed to safeguarding the privacy of student information, ensuring responsible stewardship, protection, and transparent handling of student personal information. Odyssey and Privacy Certifications Odyssey is committed to safeguarding the privacy of student information, ensuring responsible stewardship, protection, and transparent handling of student personal information. Parental Consent We collect parental consent for all students who participate in the Odyssey program. If you discover an instance where Odyssey is collecting information from a student without parental consent, please contact us immediately at privacy@odyssey.club . Compliance with Data Protection Laws Odyssey adheres to applicable data protection laws and regulations, ensuring the privacy and security of the data we handle. Data Collected by Odyssey We collect data necessary for providing Odyssey services, minimizing the data we collect about our users. This includes information from students, parents, and schools. What is the data NOT collected for? We do not allow advertising or sharing data for advertising for any data collected through Odyssey We never display ads, share data for the purpose of displaying ads, or allow data collection by advertisers or data brokers We never sell data to anyone for any purposes We never allow profiling of our users for targeted online ads Data Retention Odyssey will keep your data for only as long as it is required or as mandated by law or as requested by the 3rd party. Before deleting your data, Odyssey will send out 3 reminders to you. Cookie Policy We use Cookies and other similar services (such as Local Storage) to keep you logged in to Odyssey, customize your Odyssey experience, understand how you use Odyssey, and promote Odyssey to relevant teachers and schools. You can remove or disable cookies via your browser settings, in which case your experience with Odyssey will not be optimal. Abandoned accounts We consider an account to be abandoned if it has not been accessed for over a year. We will delete an account and all content associated with such accounts. However, to prevent accidental deletion, we will notify the teacher, the school and any other email IDs associated with the account and provide an opportunity to download the data of the abandoned account. Viewing, editing or Porting your information Parents are encouraged to work directly with teachers and school to make any changes in your data. If however, you need to get in touch with us, you can write to privacy@odyssey.club and we will work with the school and do our best to make the required changes. Teachers, administrators and parents can directly edit their information in their Odyssey profiles. Schools also have a right to use any other similar service and can place a request to get all of their data. We will do our best to comply with such requests. Once the pending request is processed, the data retention and deletion policies will be followed. Deleting Odyssey Account You have the right to “forget ability”, i.e., we will remove all your information from our systems if you so wish. If you would like to delete your Odyssey account or any content submitted to Odyssey, please send an email to to privacy@odyssey.club . We will notify you by email before deleting your account from our database. After receiving your request, we may still retain information for up to 365 days to provide customer support and prevent accidental deletion. Data Protection Practices We follow the latest, industry standards to protect your data. Some measures that are in place include use of highly secure, access-controlled data centres, data encryption in transit, and encryption data at rest etc. Despite these measures, in the event of a security breach, we will notify affected account holders within the amount of time required by the local law or by Odyssey’s internal data breach policy, whichever is more stringent, so that you can take steps to keep your data safe. Changes to the Privacy Policy We may from time to time make changes to this Privacy Policy to account for changes to our practices or applicable law. If we make changes to this Privacy Policy that we believe will materially affect your rights, we will notify you by email about these changes. If you continue to use our service after you receive notice of changes to this Privacy Policy, we will assume that you have accepted these changes. For previous versions of the Privacy Policy, please reach out to us at privacy@odyssey.club . Contact Information Our Data Protection Officer is Nikhil Gumbhir. If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, please feel free to write to us at: privacy@odyssey.club and we will reach out to you as soon as possible. If you are based in India and you have any grievance or complaint about how your personal data is being processed you can contact the Grievance Officer for India – Nikhil Gumbhir via e-mail address privacy@odyssey.club . Alex is actively involved in the planning and strategic direction of the company, including the day-to-day management decisions for the group, the subsidiary and portfolio companies. Alex is the Chairman of the group and Board member of the respective subsidiaries and portfolio companies of the group. Alex’s seasoned business leadership skills and people management expertise developed over 22 years in the finance industry allows him to successfully execute changes and bring about the company’s growth and overall success. Alex has more than two decades of experience in the onshore, offshore finance and banking industry, leading projects ranging from establishing a bank, to listing companies and building and selling asset management companies. Mr. Walker is educated in the fields of Business, Finance, Health Science and the Arts, which allows him to bring a wealth of knowledge to any business that he is managing. Mr. Lo has established a wide network of contacts in both the property and corporate sectors in Japan. Most recently, John has been, on the investor-side, working on development and asset management of hospitality assets including Ryokans as CIO of a real estate fund in Tokyo. Prior to the industry, John had been a marketing expert. His accomplishments in the arena include the launch of Apple Store in Japan as marketing manager of Apple Inc., and led Mobil Corporation’s brand management project in the Japan market as market research manager. Kakita-san obtained an MBA at Kellogg School of Northwestern University, and earned B.A. in Law at Waseda University. New - Adventures in Odyssey The next great adventure awaits. Welcome to the Club, again. The Adventures in Odyssey Club is getting an update! We thought you’d enjoy a sneak peek at the new design and exciting new features. Although some elements may change a bit in the final version, these videos reveal some of the things you can look forward to seeing in the weeks to come. Then log in beginning July 18th, 2022 for a fresh, new Club experience! Welcome to the NEW Adventures in Odyssey Club experience! Here’s what you’ll find: Enhanced Sound & Controls Listen to Adventures in Odyssey like never before. Enjoy richer sound— more than double the audio quality —and an updated, easy-to-use player. Pause episodes at any point and the player will keep your place, even across multiple devices! And with the continuous-play feature, the next episode will begin automatically when the previous one is finished. A Personalized Adventure Managing your membership is easier than ever. With the new Adventures in Odyssey Club, everyone on your account uses the same convenient login information. Meanwhile, unique user profiles and optional PINs enable each child to watch episodes individually, post their own comments, create their own playlists, and earn their own badges. Custom Playlists The new Club grants members the freedom to build playlists of their favorite audio and video content. Browse themed playlists created by our actors and special guests.
